medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Four weeks earlier, the patient developed a headache, left maxillary sinus pressure, and intermittent night sweats. Symptoms initially abated after amoxicillin treatment for presumed sinusitis, but after one week, she developed new, diffuse abdominal pain that was dull and persistent. She also experienced loose stools (three to four bowel movements daily), associated nausea, and anorexia. Night sweats worsened, and she lost 4.5 kg (10 lb) over two weeks with a recurrence of headache but without chills, melena, hematochezia, or abdominal distention.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, Raynaudâ€™s phenomenon, psoriatic arthritis, anemia of chronic disease; underwent cholecystectomy and hysterectomy many years before presentation.
medical_history.family_history: Mother with rheumatoid arthritis, father with psoriasis, sister with scleroderma.
medical_history.social_history: No known history of tobacco use, alcohol abuse, or illicit-drug use; no record of recent travel.
